definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: Becoming a winning poker player means knowing when to quit.
sentences.chinese: 成爲撲克中的贏家意味着你知道何時收手。

sentences.english: I want to learn how to play cards.
THE old-fashioned financial system was like Old Maid, a parlour game once beloved of small children.
sentences.chinese: 老式的金融系統就象是小孩子喜歡玩的一種撲克牌。

sentences.english: Until you have the expertise, don't bet on an inside straight.
sentences.chinese: 在你擁有這項專長前，不要在撲克中的順子上下賭注。

sentences.english: Today, my friends let me win at strip poker so I wouldn't take off my clothes.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我的朋友們在脫衣撲克遊戲中放水讓我贏了。

sentences.english: Once the cads are dealt, I'm looking for specific behaviors that represent meaningful tells.
sentences.chinese: 撲克牌分發之後，注意那些意味深長的特別行爲。

sentences.english: He sat a pocker-faced all the way through the film.
sentences.chinese: 即使在看電影的時候，他也是一張撲克臉。

sentences.english: Sometimes people use poker faces when negotiating a business deal.
sentences.chinese: 有時人們也將撲克臉這個短語應用於商務談判。

sentences.english: Deal It Twice is only available on real money No-Limit Hold'em ring games.
sentences.chinese: 發兩輪牌僅僅適用於無限德州撲克現金遊戲中。

sentences.english: It is fun to play card games with my best friends.
sentences.chinese: 和好朋友打撲克是一件有趣的事情。

sentences.english: Portions of this code will look like the simple Poker dealer built previously.
sentences.chinese: 這部分代碼將類似先前構建的簡單的撲克發牌器。

sentences.english: I took him for 10 pounds at the poker game.
sentences.chinese: 打撲克時我贏了他10英鎊。

sentences.english: Classic poker game - Chinese poker 13 cards.
The current generation of portable atomic clocks is roughly the size of a pack of playing cards.
sentences.chinese: 當代的便攜電子鐘大約有一個撲克牌盒那麼大。

sentences.english: The next time you do a card trick-remember this.
sentences.chinese: 當你下一次玩撲克的時候，要記住這些。

definition: to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
